resources.string: This app is to assist you to register for COVID-19 Vaccine and orientate you with the details necessary before proceeding with the registration process
Sorry you not qualify to register for this Vaccine!
Are you Healthy and Certain that you are NOT having any history of severe allergies\?
Do you understand that this vaccine does NOT fully guarantee you of not getting a COVID-19 infection in the future\?
Do you understand that taking this vaccine may cause reactions and side effects as described in the vaccine information\?
Are you willing to take this vaccine and ready to complete the total dose intake as scheduled\?
Please Confirm Your IC / Passport No

Astrazeneca
 
COVID-19 Vaccine (AZD1222) 
 
• Vaccination protects people from becoming ill with COVID-19.
 
• AstraZeneca COVID-19 Vaccine demonstrated high efficacy in clinical trials conducted in the United Kingdom and the United States, and is very effective in real world rollouts in preventing severe illness, hospitalisation and death. 
 
• AstraZeneca vaccine is approved by the National Pharmaceutical Regulatory Agency (NPRA) as a safe and effective vaccine against COVID-19 infection for adults 18 years and above. 
 
• Common side effects include pain or tenderness at the injection site, tiredness, headache, muscle pain, and fever and chills (usually for 24 to 48 hours). 
 
• An extremely rare possible side effect is thrombosis with thrombocytopenia syndrome (TTS), where 9.3 cases per million doses have been reported. 
 
• No specific risk factors have been confirmed for TTS. Available data suggest more cases in adults under 60 years of age compared to older adults, and in women compared to men. 
 
Monitor signs and symptoms between 4 to 30 days after vaccination. Please refer to the AstraZeneca Clinical Guidance for COVID-19 Vaccination (Malaysia). 
 
The benefits of vaccination greatly outweigh the risks in this situation. If you have any concerns or questions, you can discuss with your doctor before you receive the vaccine. 
 
Seek medical attention immediately if you experience 
 1. A severe persistent headache that : 
 • Does not improve with simple painkillers 
 • Gets worse when lying down or accompanied nausea and vomiting.
 2. Neurological symptoms such as : 
 • Blurred vision 
 • Difficulty with speech
 • Drowsiness 
 • Seizures 
 3. Shortness of breath or chest pain 
 4. Swelling of the legs 
 5. Persistent abdominal pain 
 6. Tiny blood spots under the skin
 
Information on the AstraZeneca vaccine 
 Monitor signs and symptoms between 4 to 30 days after vaccination. Please refer to the AstraZeneca Clinical Guidance for COVID-19 Vaccination (Malaysia). 
 The benefits of vaccination greatly outweigh the risks in this situation. If you have any concerns or questions, you can discuss with your doctor before you receive the vaccine. 
 
1. Vaxzevria (previously COVID-19 Vaccine AstraZeneca) 
 
2. The Oxford/AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine: what you need to know 
 
3. Interim recommendations for use of the ChAdOx1-S [recombinant] vaccine against COVID-19 (AstraZeneca COVID-19 
 vaccine AZD1222, SII Covishield, SK Bioscience) 
 
4. Statement of the Strategic Advisory Group of Experts (SAGE) on Immunization: Continued review of emerging evidence on AstraZeneca COVID-19 Vaccines 
 
5. Global Advisory Committee on Vaccine Safety (GACVS) review of latest evidence of rare adverse blood coagulation events with AstraZeneca COVID-19 Vaccine (Vaxzevria and Covishield) 
 
6. AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine: review of very rare cases of unusual blood clots continues 
 
Read More \@ 
vaksincovid.gov.my/en

Sinovac-Coronavac
 
MINISTRY OF HEALTH MALAYSIA 
01 WHAT IS COVID-19\?
 
COVID-19 disease is caused by a coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2. Symptoms may appear 2 to 14 days after exposure to the virus. Symptoms that may be experienced are:
 • Fever or chills
 • Cough
 • Difficulty breathing
 • Fatigue
 • Muscle or body pain
 • Headache
 • Loss of sense of taste or smell
 • Sore throat
 • Congestion or runny nose
 • Nausea or vomiting
 • Diarrhea
 
 02 WHO IS AT HIGH RISK FOR GETTING COVID-19 INFECTION\? 
The risk groups are:
 • Children
 • Senior citizens aged 60 and above
 • Patients with chronic diseases
 • Patients with low immunity
 • Pregnant women
 
03 WHAT IS THE IMPORTANCE OF TAKING COVID 19 VACCINE\? 
The COVID-19 vaccine is given to control the transmission of COVID-19 disease. As more people get vaccinated, more and more people form antibodies and in turn reduce the likelihood of more severe COVID-19 disease. Indirectly it can protect at -risk groups who are not eligible for vaccination.
 
04 WHAT IS THE LAW ON TAKING COVID-19 VACCINE\? 
The Special Meeting of the Muzakarah Committee of the National Council for Islamic Religious Affairs which convened on 3 December 2020 decided that the law on the use of COVID-19 vaccine is a MUST AND MUST BE TAKEN by groups designated by the government.
 
05 WHO IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE COVID-19 CORONAVAC VACCINE\? 
All Malaysians aged 18 years and above are eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine CoronaVac.
 
06 WHO IS NOT ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE COVID-19 CORONAVAC VACCINE\? 
You are not eligible to receive the COVID-19 CoronaVac vaccine if you:
 • Have an allergy to CoronaVac or any of the ingredients in CoronaVac (please see the Product Description section). Signs of an allergic reaction may include a rash or itchy skin, shortness of breath and swelling of the face or tongue. Call your doctor or go to the emergency unit at the nearest hospital immediately if you experience an allergic reaction.
 • Have a history of allergies to any other vaccines
 • Have a serious neurological disease such as spinal cord inflammation (transverse
 myelitis), demyelinating diseases and Guillain-Barre syndrome
 • Have a severe and or chronic illness that is out of control
 • If you are pregnant or breastfeeding
 
Vaccination to individuals who are suffering from acute diseases such as acute diseases, acute exacerbation of chronic diseases, severe chronic diseases, allergies and fever should be delayed if necessary.
 
07 ARE CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS AND ELDERLY ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE THE CORONAVAC VACCINE\? 
CoronaVac is not recommended for children 18 years of age and younger due to limited safety and efficacy data at this time.
 
Seniors 60 years of age and older are eligible for the CoronaVac vaccine.
 
08 CAN I GET THE COVID-19 VACCINE IF I AM PREGNANT OR BREASTFEEDING\? 
Data on the use of CoronaVac by pregnant or breastfeeding women are limited. The use of this vaccine by pregnant women and breastfeeding mothers is NOT RECOMMENDED at this time.
 
09 AM I GIVEN THE CHOICE TO CHOOSE THE COVID-19 VACCINE TYPE\? 
NO. Vaccine recipients are not allowed to choose the type of COVID-19 vaccine they will receive. It depends on the existing stock supply at the vaccination center as well as the individual's assessment of the types of vaccines available.
 However, vaccine recipients who cannot receive a particular vaccine due to a medical problem such as an allergy can be given another more appropriate vaccine.
 
10 IS COVID-19 CORONAVAC VACCINE SAFE TO USE IN MALAYSIA\? 
The Drug Control Authority of Malaysia has allowed conditional registration of vaccine use in Malaysia. 
Emergency Use Permits (EUA) have also been approved by several other regulatory agencies such as in Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Paraguay, China, Hong Kong, Turkey, Cambodia and Indonesia.
 
11 WHAT SHOULD I INFORM THE HEALTH OFFICER BEFORE RECEIVING COVID-19 CORONAVAC VACCINE INJECTION\? 
Inform the health care provider if you:
 • Have a history of severe allergies
 • Currently receiving treatment that lowers the body's immune system
 • Have severe neurological diseases such as Tranverse Myelitis, Guillian-Barre Syndrome,
 Demyelinating Disease
 • Have a chronic illness
 
Read More \@ 
vaksincovid.gov.my/en

Pfizer-BioNTech
 
COVID-19 COMIRNATY VACCINE INFORMATION (PFIZER-BIONTECH COMPANY) FOR VACCINE RECIPIENTS
 
WHAT IS COVID-19 \? 
COVID-19 disease is caused by a coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2. Symptoms may appear 2 to 14 days after exposure to the virus. Symptoms that may be experienced are:
 • Fever or chills
 • Cough
 • Difficulty breathing
 • Fatigue
 • Loss of sense of taste or smell
 • Sore throat
 • Congestion or runny nose
 • Nausea or vomiting
 • Diarrhea
 • Muscle or body pain
 • Headache
 
 The risk groups are:
 • Children
 • Senior citizens aged 60 and above
 • Patients with chronic diseases
 • Patients with low immunity
 • Pregnant women
 
WHAT IS THE IMPORTANCE OF TAKING COVID 19 VACCINE\? 
The COVID-19 vaccine is given to control the transmission of COVID-19 disease. As more people get vaccinated, more and more people form antibodies and in turn reduce the likelihood of more severe COVID-19 disease. Indirectly it can protect at -risk groups who are not eligible for vaccination.
 
WHAT KIND OF VACCINE WILL BE USED IN MALAYSIA\? 
There are several types that will be used in Malaysia, namely:
 • Pfizer-BioNtech Covid-19 mRNA vaccine
 • Covid-19 viral vector vaccine produced by Astra Zeneka
 • Sinovac's inactivated Covid-19 vaccine
 • Covid-19 recombinant viral vector vaccine produced by CanSino
 • Gamaleya's Covid-19 viral vector vaccine
 
WHO IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE COVID-19 COMIRNATY (PFIZER-BIONTECH) VACCINE\? 
All Malaysians aged 18 years and above are eligible to receive the COVID-19 COMIRNATY (Pfizer-BioNTech) vaccine. Priority is given to frontline workers, those at high risk of getting COVID-19 infection such as the elderly, patients with medical problems such as heart patients, diabetes, high blood pressure, asthma, cancer and so on. 

WHO IS NOT ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE COVID-19 COMIRNATY (PFIZER-BIONTECH) VACCINE\?
 
You are not eligible to receive the COVID-19 COMIRNATY (Pfizer-BioNTech) vaccine if you have: 
• History of severe allergic reactions or history of anaphylaxis after receiving first dose of mRNA vaccine such as COVID-19 COMIRNATY vaccine (Pfizer-BioNTech) 
 
Note: An allergic reaction is considered severe if the individual needs to be treated in a hospital 
 
• Allergic reactions to any content of COVID-19 mRNA vaccine even if not severe (allergic reactions that occur within 4 hours after receiving COVID-19 mRNA vaccine injection). Individuals who experience this reaction after receiving the first dose of COVID-19 mRNA vaccine, will not be given a second dose
 
• History of severe allergic reactions or history of anaphylaxis after taking any medication or food or to an unknown substance
 
WHAT ARE THE LAWS OF TAKING COVID-19 VACCINE\? 
The Special Meeting of the Muzakarah Committee of the National Council for Islamic Religious Affairs which convened on 3 December 2020 decided that the law on the use of COVID-19 vaccine should and must be taken by groups designated by the Government.
 
AM I GIVEN THE CHOICE TO CHOOSE THE COVID-19 VACCINE TYPE\? 
No. Vaccine recipients are not allowed to choose the type of COVID-19 vaccine they will receive. It depends on the existing stock supply at the vaccination center. 
 
IS COVID-19 COMIRNATY (PFIZER-BIONTECH) VACCINE SAFE TO USE IN MALAYSIA\? 
Yes, this vaccine is safe to use because it has been registered and was approved by the National Pharmaceutical Regulatory Division (NPRA) on 8 January 2021 for its use in Malaysia. The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has authorized the use of the COVID-19 COMIRNATY Vaccine (Pfizer-BioNTech) as an emergency measure to prevent COVID-19 in individuals 16 years of age and older under the Emergency Use Permission (EUA).
 
The World Health Organization (WHO) has certified that the COVID-19 COMIRNATY (Pfizer-BioNTech) vaccine can be used for emergency purposes on 31 December 2020. 
It has also been approved by health authorities in the USA, UK, European countries, Israel and Singapore. In fact, 48 countries have certified the use of this vaccine.
 
WHAT SHOULD I INFORM THE HEALTH OFFICER BEFORE RECEIVING COVID-19 COMIRNATY (PFIZER-BIONTECH) VACCINE INJECTION\? 
Inform the health care provider if you:
 • Have a history of severe allergies; 
 • Have bleeding disorders such as Haemophilia, Idiopathic, Thrombocytopenic Purpura (ITP) and so on;
 • Are undergoing treatment for blood thinners;
 • Are receiving treatment that lowers the body immune system;
 • Are pregnant or planning to become pregnant;
 • Breastfeeding;
 • Have received COVID-19 vaccine from another brand 
You are advised to consult a specialist doctor first to determine the suitability for me 
 
Read More \@ 
vaksincovid.gov.my/en

STAY HOME, STAY SAFE, CORONAVIRUS IS REAL, PROTECT YOURSELF AND YOUR FAMILY. REMEMBER YOUR APPOINTMENT DATE AND ENCOURAGE YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY TO TAKE THE VACCINE...DO NOT HESITATE TO CONTACT THE NEAREST HOSPITAL IF YOU NOTICE ANY CORONAVIRUS SYMPTOMS
What Does Lindung Diri, Lindung Semua Mean\?

Lindung Diri, Lindung Semua is the main theme of the National COVID-19 Immunisation Programme which emphasises that protection for all Malaysians will only be achieved if we can vaccinate as many eligible individuals. When each individual takes the vaccine, they will be able to protect the people around them from any infections that may be carried by them. Imagine, if the majority of Malaysians take the vaccine injection, we could build a protective network that could also protect groups who are not eligible for immunisation such as children and pregnant women. Protecting your loved ones starts with you through the vaccination. When at least 70 percent of the population has been vaccinated, we will be well protected as a whole. As mentioned, none of us are safe until all of us are safe. Protection for all starts from ourselves. So, get vaccinated. Lindung Diri, Lindung Semua.
How do I make an appointment\?

Your appointment will be made once you have completed the questionnaire by visiting the Dashboard and click on any vaccine you want to register. Your answers to the quiz will determine whether you will be able to proceed with the vaccine registration and an appointment will be scheduled after successful registration. You can then Login to check if any changes occur.
What should I do if my current location is not available\?
Login, and click on List of vaccine administration and you can see the nearest location near you
Are there any hotline numbers I can call to find out more about the COVID-19 vaccination registration\?
Go to Dashboard and click on the Vaccine hotline Number and you can dial it directly on this app once you click it
I have registered for vaccination. What Next\?

Vaccination candidates will receive confirmation of date and assigned Vaccination Distribution Centre PPV two weeks before their scheduled appointment. Within the two weeks, candidates will also get reminders via phone call or SMS.
When will I know all appointment details\?

Vaccination candidates will receive confirmation of date and assigned Vaccination Distribution Centre PPV two weeks before their scheduled appointment. Within the two weeks, candidates will also get reminders via phone call or SMS.
What is comorbidity and how will I know if I have it\?

Comorbidity is when an individual has preExisting health conditions like high blood pressure, diabetes, heart disease, kidney disease, liver disease, low immunity, asthma, cancer, chronic lung disease, stroke or obesity. Comorbidity can only be certified by qualified medical professionals.
I have high blood pressure and high cholesterol but it is under control and I need no medication. Does that mean I have comorbidity\?
Please consult a qualified medical professional to determine your current comorbidity status.
I recently underwent a surgery to remove a growth. Does that mean I have comorbidity\?
Yes. Although the growth has been removed, you are still considered to have comorbidity.
